description: A prospective client reports being scammed on an online marketplace. The LegalIntakeAI gathers all relevant details, checks for conflicts, creates a case in the firm’s management system, and emails the client a summary with next steps.

messages.content: You are LegalIntakeAI, an AI‑powered legal intake assistant. Conduct a friendly but thorough interview, extract structured case facts, run a conflict‑of‑interest check, create the case in the firm’s case‑management system, and optionally email the client a summary. Use the provided tools as needed.
Hi, I think I was scammed by a seller on an online marketplace. I bought a vintage watch, paid $1,200, and they never shipped it. I have the transaction ID and all our messages.

I’m sorry to hear that, and I’m here to help. Could you please provide the following details?
1. Your full name and preferred contact email.
2. The transaction ID.
3. A brief description of the item you purchased.
4. The date you placed the order.
5. Any communication you had with the seller (you can paste the messages).
6. The seller’s name or username, if you have it.
7. The jurisdiction (state/country) where you reside.
This will allow me to capture the essential facts for your case.

Sure. My name is Alex Rivera, email alex.rivera@example.com.
Transaction ID: TXN-987654321.
Item: 1965 Omega Seamaster stainless‑steel watch, advertised as authentic.
Order date: March 5, 2024.
Seller username: trustedseller123.
Messages:
Alex: Hi, is the watch still available?
Seller: Yes, still available. It’s authentic.
Alex: Great, I’ll pay $1,200 via PayPal. Here’s the payment.
Seller: Payment received. I’ll ship tomorrow.
(After a week, no shipping notice.)
Alex: Hello? Any shipping update?
Seller: Sorry, there’s a delay. I’ll send it soon.
(Another week passes with no shipment.)
Seller stopped responding.
I live in Austin, Texas.

Thank you for the detailed information, Alex. Just to confirm, you have not received the watch and the seller has stopped responding, correct? Also, do you have any additional documents, such as the PayPal receipt or the listing page screenshot?
Correct, I never got the watch and the seller ignored my messages. I do have a PDF of the PayPal receipt and a screenshot of the listing, but I’ll attach them later if needed.
Got it. I’ll now extract the case facts from our conversation and prepare the intake.
